basis: The user explicitly commits to logging right after meals and to set reminders, mentions the specific snack portion, and frames the plan as doable despite irregular eating.
cognitive_dissonance: Moderate; recognizes irregular eating but seeks consistency and uses reminders to bridge gaps.
negative_thought_patterns: Worry about forgetting how they felt afterward; potential self-criticism if recall is unreliable; concern about maintaining memory in irregular eating patterns.
emotional_triggers: Desire for stability and control; fear of forgetting; motivation to manage hydration and routine even on tough days.
coaching_notes: Maintain emphasis on small, concrete actions (log after meals, set reminders). Consider habit-stacking (e.g., log immediately after each meal before dessert) to reduce cognitive load. Validate progress and normalize variability in diet while reinforcing consistent micro-habits.
